metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7919 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Go before 1.12.16 and 1.13.x before 1.13.7 (and the crypto/cryptobyte package before 0.0.0-20200124225646-8b5121be2f68 for Go) allows attacks on clients (resulting in a panic) via a malformed X.509 certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7919` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.13 - 1.13.7-1ubuntu1
golang-1.13-go - 1.13.7-1ubuntu1
golang-1.13-src - 1.13.7-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Packages built using golang need to be rebuilt once the vulnerability has been fixed. This CVE entry does not list packages that need rebuilding outside of the main repository or the Ubuntu variants with PPA overlays.

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.13.7-1ubuntu1').
